meetup-Agile-Connexions-Romania-23508329.description:
We are pleased to announce the following event in conjunction with Endava & IIBA Romania.


IMPORTANT INFORMATION:

For security purposes you MUST register here on the IIBA eventbrite site to confirm your attendance on this event.

One of the most challenging and trouble-prone aspects of agile product development is discovering the right product requirements to deliver at the right time, for the right customer. Many teams rely on user stories to discover and define agile product requirements. In reality user stories often lead to a confusing array of struggles and puzzles, such as bloated backlogs, ineffective or inconsistent planning, and erratic Sprint flow. This thrashing is not how user stories are intended to work!


Join EBG’s Ellen Gottesdiener in this fast-paced introduction of a common sense, tested approach to user stories. With a laser-like focus on delivering value, you follow a story as it’s sliced across the 7 Product Dimensions. You learn how the Structured Conversation framework enables you to quickly explore, evaluate, and confirm stories. See how making your user stories “ready” is the key for incremental delivery of your “Done” product.  

Event structure: Presentation, Q&A and Networking
This event is valuable for all members of agile discovery and delivery teams including: Business Analysts, Requirements Engineers, Scrum Masters, Agile project advisors.

About the Speaker

Ellen is a pioneer in the use of collaborative practices for product discovery, emphasizing the convergence of agile + requirements + product management. She helps product and development communities produce valuable outcomes and happy teams. Ellen is coauthor with Mary Gorman of Discover to Deliver: Agile Product Planning and Analysis & two additional acclaimed books on collaboration & software requirements. She is Chief Product Owner of EBG Consulting, which helps organizations amplify discovery to accelerate delivery. @ellengott 

Host: Endava (www.endava.com) @endava


Sponsor: Learning Connexions (www.learningconnexions.com)  @lconnexions 


Sponsor: IIBA Romania Chapter (romania.iiba.org) @IIBA

IMPORTANT INFORMATION:

For security purposes you MUST register here on the IIBA eventbrite site to confirm your attendance on this event.
meetup-Agile-Connexions-Romania-23508329.title: Making Your User Stories “Ready” to Get to “Done” with Ellen Gottesdiener

meetup-AngularJS-Bucharest-235237819.description:
Hello friends,

We're not done with meetups this year!

We proudly invite you to a special event from AngularJS Bucharest, Tuesday, the 8th of November @ Techhub. We continue our journey into Angular 2 land and we bring you 2 talks that dive deep into both specific tech used within the ng2 world (TypeScript) and experience gained by early adoption of ng2 for production apps.

Schedule


18:30 - Participants arrival

19:00 - Intro

19: 10 - The Lowdown on TypeScript 

We'll take 30 minutes to explore the main features and selling points of TypeScript, take a peek into the future of the language, and share some tips and tricks on its real-world usage. 

by Sorin Peste - Technical Evangelist, Microsoft 

Ever since he's written his first small BASIC program at age ten, Sorin has never given up on writing code. He's worked professionally (mostly) with the Microsoft stack since 2003, and five years ago he's joined Microsoft to work on fun projects and learn from many smart people.

19:45 - break

20: 00 - Adventures with Angular 2

The talk will be about what made us decide to pick Angular 2 since its beta phase, why we didn't stop when we saw that it wasn't quite ok to work with beta versions, how we managed to keep our up up to date with version updates (sometimes even twice a week), how we rewrote our application several times and how we found solutions to most problems.

by Dragos Cristian Ionita - Software engineer, Adore Me

I build business tools (complex interfaces + data) for Adore Me, i'm a frontend developer for 4 years now (ex backend developer for 5 years). I'm currently using Angular 2 and its suite of tools and technologies: webpack, typescript, rxjs, sass etc. but in the past i've played around quite a bit with NodeJS, Angular 1, jQuery, Backbone etc.

More specific details to follow. Hope to see you there!

Have a grand day,

AngularJS Bucharest Team

Descriere:
i. Microservices with Java/Spring and Hana
ii. Front-end : Spring MVC si SAP UI5
iii. IaaS in HCP (VMs or Docker)

Prezentarea 2: Build an Intelligent Bot to Interact with your Users

Prezentator : Sorin Peste ,Microsoft, https://github.com/neaorin/BotFrameworkDemo


Bots are all the rage these days. But if you need one that's capable to understand your users' natural language, so it can figure out what they WANT and not just what they say, then you're going to need some pretty strong AI behind it. Come to this session to find out how you can use Microsoft Bot Framework together with Language Understanding Intelligent Service (luis.ai) to build an intelligent bot for Skype, Slack, Facebook, SMS and more.

This talk will discuss the problem of using the game of StarCraft (and its successor StarCraft II) as a research environment for AI. The presentation will consist of two main parts:

• Discussion of the recent work done by Facebook AI Research on StarCraft micromanagement tasks [1] and the soon to be released TorchCraft library [2].

• Keynote on StarCraft as a testbed for general artificial intelligence, in which I will address the numerous challenges posed by this game, from the perspective of an AI researcher and former professional StarCraft player.



Main Reading Materials:

• [1] Episodic Exploration for Deep Deterministic Policies for StarCraft Micromanagement - https://openreview.net/forum?id=r1LXit5ee

Additional Reading Materials:

• [2] TorchCraft: a Library for Machine Learning Research on Real-Time Strategy Games (white paper) - https://arxiv.org/abs/1611.00625


• [3] A Survey of Real-Time Strategy Game AI Research and Competition in StarCraft - https://hal.inria.fr/file/index/docid/871001/filename/survey.pdf

Speaker: Ionel Hosu

meetup-Bucharest-Mobile-Development-Meet.description:
Hey all,  
We're glad to announce a new Mobile Developers Meetup, on November 16th 2016!  

Join us for two presentations at the Deutsche Bank headquarters, the sponsor of the event.

Drinks and snacks included.

1. UI/UX evolution on Mobile Platforms

An overview of the UI/UX design evolution for iOS and Android. Insights on maximizing the usability of a smaller screen size and current design trends.

Our guest speakers, Mihai Betej and Vlad Voinescu, work as Mobile Developers at Deutsche Bank.

---

2. Kotlin island … for Android

Known as the “Swift” of Android, Kotlin is a new programming language which is 100% compatible with JAVA and it’s libraries while sitting on top of the JVM. It’s modern syntax, native support for Lambdas / closures, safety (by reducing the well known NPE’s) and concise structure make it ideal for Android development. Forget about writing entire “for each” loops with the help of list iterators, learn about companion objects and lazily assigned variable values alongside class extensions, named parameters and default parameter values at the next meetup.

Our guest speaker for this session is Cornel Balaban, Mobile Engineering Manager at Avira Romania.

See you there,  
The Mobile Academy team

---

Agenda:  
18:45 - 19:15 Registration & networking  
19:15 - 20:00 Mihai Betej and Vlad Voinescu, Deutsche Bank
20:00 - 20:45 Cornel Balaban, Avira Romania
20:45 - 21:30 Networking

meetup-Cluj-Javascripters-235154341.description:
After two really good sessions on promises, it's time we continue our adventure with a deep dive into prototypal inheritance in Javascript. We will explore how objects are created, how they link to each other and how they are different from other languages.


The training will focus on the following things:


- Ways of creating objects and differences between them

- What are those prototypes exactly?

- How are objects linked together

- Prototypal inheritance vs classic inheritance

- ES2015 classes

- An open panel and Q&A. 


The training is for beginners so only basic programming and javascript syntax is required.


Needed tools:


- Your own laptop with NodeJS installed 

- Your favorite text editor!
meetup-Cluj-Javascripters-235154341.title: Javascript training - Prototypal inheritance - first class

meetup-Cluj-Javascripters-235621652.description:
Hi there Clu[JS]ers, 

My name is Andrei Cacio and I am happy to announce the next training session. I've been doing web development for about 5 years and I just got this wonderful opportunity to host the next workshop in the cluj javascript community.

Without further ado -- allow me continue the training sessions with a smooth introduction to Webpack. This tool is the kingpin for most of our projects and a huge step for modern JavaScript and web development altogether. Together we will learn more about this gizmo and why it is so useful.

The training will cover the following:

- What is a build tool and why do we need it

- What is webpack doing differently

- How to write your first webpack config file

- A few words about modules in JavaScript

- Building javascript files

- How to add CSS/SASS/IMAGES to our project

- How to add ES2015 support

- How to work in different environments (development/production)

- Open discussion and Q&A

Required knowledge:

The training will be for javascript beginners, so basic programming concepts and javascript syntax is required to fully benefit from this training.


Tools needed:

- nodejs 4.x

- npm 3.x

- webpack 1.x

- some sort of command line

NOTE: There are two identical sessions held on the 24th and 25th of November, you only need to register to one of them.

PS: Don't forget to join our facebook group and share with us interesting links and ideas that you encounter.
meetup-Cluj-Javascripters-235621652.title: Training - Introduction to Webpack - Session 1

Dragi Mobile Developers, 

În calitate de membri ai comunității Tech Academy, vă invităm să participați gratuit la Transylvania MegaHack, eveniment cu care debutează festivalul tehnologic Cluj TechFest vineri, pe 11 noiembrie. 

MegaHack din cadrul TechFest este un eveniment dedicat programatorilor și echipelor de programatori care vor răspunde unor provocări lansate de diverse companii, provocări reale cu care acestea se confruntă și pentru care caută cele mai bune soluții. Alege-ți provocarea, înscrie-ți echipa și puteți câștiga unul dintre premiile care au o valoare totală de 10,000 EUR. 

Pentru că faci parte din comunitatea TechAcademy beneficiezi de înscriere gratuită. 

Folosește codul TECHACADEMYFRIENDS și înscrie-te acum: http://techfest.ro/register-for-access/ 

BRD – Groupe Société Générale, PITECH+PLUS & PARKING+PLUS, Primăriile Municipiilor Cluj-Napoca și Alba Iulia, Life is Hard & eOKEY.ro ți-au pregătit provocări și premii senzaționale din domeniile Digital Banking și Smart City. Detalii despre ele, formularul de înregistrare dar și despre restul challenge-urilor găsești pe pagina Transylvania MegaHack.

meetup-Cluj-Napoca-WordPress-Meetup-2356.description:
Hello hello!

We're happy to announce the next WordPress Meetup, on December 7th at 6:30PM. It's gonna be the last one of the year, so we hope to see all of you :D

This time we plan on having 2 presentations.

So this is an open call for speakers.
If you would like to make a presentation, please write to us!

You can pick any subject you want, as long as it is connected to WordPress. It can be about business, design, development, your experience with WordPress, etc.

I am really excited to announce that we already have 1 presentation lined up: 
Why being hacked was a good thing -  by Valentin Vesa . He talks about his experience of having the ShoeBox site hacked and where that led him eventually. No more spoilers - I hope you'll wanna find out the rest.

The schedule will be: 

18:30 - Arrival of members

19:00 -  Why being hacked was a good thing - by Valentin Vesa 

19:45 - Second presentation

Socialising & pizza

Also, since it's right after Moș Nicolae, there will definitely be candy - if you've been good :)

Looking forward to seeing you!

meetup-Cluj-Software-Developers-23498983.description:
On 15th of November we will host Technology Open Days in our office, under the TechFest umbrella. It will be a whole day of talks and workshops.

14:00-17:00 

Behavior-Driven Development Automation Framework with Selenium and  SpecFlow in C#

Behavior-Driven Development (BDD) is a software development process that emerged from Test-Driven Development (TDD). Behavior-Driven Development combines the general techniques and principles of TDD with ideas from Domain-Driven Design and Object-Oriented Analysis and Design (OOAD) to provide software development and management teams with shared tools and a shared process to collaborate on software development. 

Presenter: Sebastian Silaghi, Senior Software Developer Engineer in Test

With a strong background in the software quality assurance domain, Sebastian prides himself on a ‘can do’ attitude, always ensuring the highest of standards and is driven by results. A great interest in automation testing, he continuously challenges himself to improve the automation process and identify the best solutions.


Summary:


In this workshop you can explore options how to improve testing efficiency by looking at UI automation from a different angle by analysing and understanding the UI concepts used in the application, matching them to domain model elements and build an automation solution that focuses on these.

The workshop is based on hands-on exercises and discussions, where we automate different parts of a web application, with Selenium WebDriver and SpecFlow.

Through the exercises we try to find answers to questions like:

Where to start in the testing process? What to test and what not to test? How much to test in one go? What to call the tests? How to understand why a test fails?

·  What is beyond page object pattern?

·  What are the UI concepts and why are they important?

·  How can you express web automation with domain model terms?

·  How can such test fit into a BDD-DDD process?

·  How can you address asynchronous issues?

·  Is it possible to do test-first with web UI automation?

·  What other benefits can be given to us by such a test system?

Requirements:

The presentation and the coding examples will use .NET, SpecFlow and the .NET implementation of Selenium.

You will need at least basic knowledge of C# and a bit of Selenium WebDriver experience.

Bring your enthusiasm and good disposition – all else is provided :)

The participation is free of charge.


Seats are limited! Register now at adriana.fratean@veinteractive.com 

If you haven't sent your contact details (phone+ email address) to Adriana, your seat was not reserved but you can be added on a waiting list.

meetup-Cluj-Software-Developers-23498983.venue: Cluj Business Center: str. Henri Barbusse 44-46, Cluj-Napoca

meetup-Cluj-Software-Developers-23512723.description:
On 15th of November we will host Technology Open Days in our office, under the TechFest umbrella. It will be a whole day of talks and workshops. The first part of the day will be dedicated to IT students.


9:30 - 13:00

Workshop

Summary

We are preparing a workshop focused on describing software systems through the use of diagrams. We will focus on their representation, importance and meaningfulness. We will offer you the opportunity to improve your skills in this area. Be ready to involve yourself in catchy exercises!

Moderators: Doru Ciceu, Radu Badiu, Marius Tisa & Florentina Suciu

The journey of a junior: Why? When? How?

Summary

We all had or will have the pretty scary-but-still-exciting moment when will pass from the easy-breezy life of a student to the 8 hour employee status. I don't have all the answers on how to do it 'like a boss' but you'll get to hear how I did it :)

Presenter: Corina Godja, Software Developer

Corina is a one year newbie in the .NET mystical land, trying to decipher it in Ve. Outgoing and childish, will blush as soon as she'll start talking, but bear with her or laugh with her about it. Eager to learn and evolve in the tech field in order to exceed her newbie status.

Coding in school vs coding in real life

Summary:

Things are different in real life when it comes to software development…but not in a bad way. In school, your project requirements are pretty simple, straightforward and sound something like “just make it work!”. In real life, this is not so simple. The requirements change, the teams change, even the end results change. I want to tell you what the software development job really means with all its ups and downs and to give you some insights regarding the processes, the quality standards and how the things are done in a software company.

Presenter: Ioan Sut, Scrum Master & Software Developer

Ioan is a Scrum Master and .NET Developer at VeInteractive; currently working on various .NET projects using the latest technologies on the market. He believes expanding your knowledge every day is incredibly beneficial; both professionally and personally. Ioan is keen to share what he has learnt as a software developer and scrum master in order to help others improve their performance in their day to day work and to offer a different vision of software craftsmanship.

meetup-Cluj-fp-234852040.description:
Programul intalnirii:
6:30-7:00 sosirea participantilor + pizza din partea Ullink
7:00 - 8:00 - Alexandru Gherega - (peek @Clojure)

Inventat in 2007 si noua ani mai tarziu, Clojure se remarca ca fiind o tehnologie de actualitate.

Acceptat in familia limbajelor functionale utilizate in proiecte industriale active si complexe – o familie nu foarte numeroasa – este de dorit sa mentinem o perspectiva congruenta intre filozofia abordata si Clojure ca si tehnologie de dezvoltare in mediul industrial.

In cadrul prezentarii vom acoperi o parte din nucleul tehnologie Clojure – i.e. “ways of Clojure”, principalele diferente fata de alte limbaje Lisp, cele mai importante structuri de date. Vom parcurge de asemenea cateva elemente mai avansate precum metodele de evaluare, multimetode, ierarhii si generarea claselor. In ultima parte a prezentarii new vom apropia de cateva din cele mai comune pattern-uri de design Clojure, API-uri pentru Web, severul REPL – o componenta esentiala pentru a reduce timpul petrecut intre implementarea unei idei si rezultatul net al acesteia (similar variantei scurte a Scrisorii a III-a: Tu esti Mircea? Nu! - simplu dar eficient). In finalul prezentarii vom acoperi cateva din povestile de succes care utilizeaza Clojure si, in cazul in care continuumul spatiu-time va rataci un dumicat de energie, ne vom satisface curiozitatea cu niste mostre de codare in Clojure.

Speram ca la final sa acomodati o alta unealta la lista de compulsii privind cresterea abilitatilor din sfera programarii functionale.

Mai multe detalii despre Alex gasiti pe linkedin https://ro.linkedin.com/in/alexandru-gherega-73340719
meetup-Cluj-fp-234852040.title: (peek @Clojure)

meetup-Cluj-fp-235150131.description:
Programul intalnirii:
6:30-7:00 sosirea participantilor + pizza din partea Ullink
7:00 - 8:00 - Mihai Andrei - Imutabilitatea din perspectiva programarii stiintifice

Mihai are in spate o experienta mixta de proiecte de cercetare si comerciale. In ultima vreme a dezvoltat simulari numerice pentru neuroscience. A folosit si apreciaza limbajele functionale dar considera ca limbaje cum ar fi C sau Prolog isi au locul lor.

Prezentarea isi propune sa discute ideea de imutabilitate atat in mediul ei natural, programarea functionala, cat si departe de el in limbaje foarte mutabile cum ar fi C. Problema performantei va fi adresata discutand despre structuri de date persistente.

Programarea cu valori imutabile generaza programe mai simple. Multe stari invalide devin imposibile. Multe proceduri devin functii pure. In programarea functionala valorile imutabile sunt esentiale, fac parte din definitia termenului.

Mutabilele isi au rolul lor insa starile se schimba in timp iar unele manipulari low level de structuri sunt obligatoriu mutabile.

Singurul dezavantaj major al imutabilelor, performanta, este ameliorata de structuri de date speciale. Numite "persistent data structures" acestea permit copierea ieftina a unei valori. Vom exemplifica implementarea unor asemenea structuri.
meetup-Cluj-fp-235150131.title: Imutabilitatea din perspectiva programarii stiintifice
meetup-Cluj-fp-235150131.venue: Sediul Ullink: Str Victor Deleu nr 1, et 3 (intrarea dinspre Parcul Caragiale), cluj-napoca

meetup-Constan\u021ba-Web-Developers-235.description:
La acest meetup vom încerca ceva diferit. Vom urmări o prezentare pe video-proiector apoi vom putea discuta la bere despre ea. Putem discuta despre prezentare sau despre orice altceva ne trece prin cap.

Prezentarea se va decide în urma poll-ului de aici: https://www.facebook.com/groups/1630405593875560/permalink/1755602371355881/

Program 
18:45 - Se strânge lumea
19:00 - Prezentare pe videoproiector - PHP7 and Beyond: The Future of PHP — php[world] 2015 — Anthony Ferrara
19:45 - Pauză
20:00 - Prezentare pe videoproiector - Evan You - Modern Frontend with Vue.js - Laracon EU 2016
20:40 - Open discussion & bericeală & networkingăreală 
21:30 - Încheierea oficială a întâlnirii (de obicei lumea rămâne și după)

Descriere prezentări
PHP7 and Beyond: The Future of PHP — php[world] 2015 — Anthony Ferrara
PHP is experiencing a renaissance; old methodologies are everywhere under assault from advances in tooling and design. From Composer to HackLang, "the PHP way" of solving problems is dramatically evolving. Walls between projects are falling; interoperability and collaboration are happening on levels never thought possible. What do these accelerating changes mean for the future of the language? What might PHP8 look like? How will our communities continue to collaborate and evolve? And most pressing: what steps can we take to ensure PHP's continuing vibrancy in the face of future technical challenges?

Evan You - Modern Frontend with Vue.js - Laracon EU 2016
Frontend development has undergone some big advanced in the last two years - if you are still managing user interactions with ad-hoc jQuery scripts, it's time to take a look at the new tools available. In particular, two of the best ideas in modern frontend developent are declarative DOM rendering and composable view components. In this talk I will discuss why these ideas can make your frontend code much easier to write and maintain, and why Vue.js is an ideal library choice if you want to adopt these ideas.


Locație 
Strings Club - https://www.facebook.com/StringsClub/?fref=ts

Numărul locurilor fiind limitat (maxim 30), te rugăm sa anunți disponibilitatea (RVSP).

Altele În secțiunea de mai jos poți posta orice tip de întrebare (chiar și idei pentru meetup sau pentru open discussion).

Sună-mă la[masked] (Felix) dacă ai nelămuriri, întrebări sau chef de bere :)

PS: Suntem și pe Facebook!

meetup-FinTech-Camp-Community-Romania-23.description:
REGISTER for your free place here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/fintech-hackathon-4-6-november-2016-techhub-bucharest-registration-28549126205


→ Where? What?

Romanian FinTech Hackathon. Second edition but the first one in Bucuresti, Romania.

→ Who can participate?
Tech developers and Business-oriented people that want to build something together for the Fintech space.

Places are limited, there's a selection in place, so register while you can!


→ Who is organizing it?
Fintech enthusiasts from Romanian startups and companies like: Minutizer Pay Per Minute, TechHub and UltraHack.

→ What can/should you build in this hackathon?
Anything related to fintech. But think about SEPA, PSD2, FX, BTC and other acronyms like these.

Here are some ideas:
- most of the people work every day but get paid only at the end of the month. Why shouldn't we use the tech available today to pay employees at the end of each day? Or every hour. Or minute. 
- how easy and cheap could Romanians that live abroad send money back home or pay the bills for their families here in Romania? 
- Slack, Skype, Kik, Facebook Messenger bots are the new hot trend right now. How can you build one to help users pay for stuff or send/exchange money to others?
- blockchain or ethereum can be used today to have a decentralized version of almost anything. what would you like to descentralize?

visit www.fintech.camp/bucharest/ and register at https://www.eventbrite.com/e/fintech-hackathon-4-6-november-2016-techhub-bucharest-registration-28549126205

meetup-ITCamp-Community-235877883.description:
În luna Decembrie, ITCamp organizează un nou eveniment pentru profesioniștii IT din Cluj-Napoca. Evenimentul urmează să aibă loc pe data de 07 Decembrie, la sediul Endava (United Business Center, lângă Iulius Mall). Participarea la eveniment este gratuită. Mulțumim Endava pentru găzduire.

Event page: http://itcamp-community-2016-12.eventbrite.com


Program:

17:45 – 18:15 – Welcoming & Registration 

18:15 – 19:00 – Systems Development in a Changing World – Eoin Woods

19:00 – 19:15 – Coffe Break

19:15 – 20:00 – Empower your Raspberry PI using Azure IoT Suite – Radu Vunvulea

20:00 – 21:00 – Augmented Reality in Industrial Predictive Maintenance, including HoloLens – Tibor Molnar

21:00 – 22:00 – Networking


Descrierea sesiunilor:

- Systems Development in a Changing World (Eoin Woods): The way we build systems is changing. From our history of monolithic systems, then distributed systems, to Internet connected systems, we are now entering the era of cloud-hosted, microservice based, pay-for-usage system development. What does the history of software development tell us about the challenges of this new environment? And how does our approach to building systems need to evolve in order to meet them?

- Empower your Raspberry PI using Azure IoT Suite (Radu Vunvulea): What can you do with smart devices nowadays? In the next 45 minutes we will take a look on what we can do With Raspberry PI and how this device can become the brain of an intelligent house or office. The session will contain a lot of demos explaining what we can do to empower this smart device with the IoT Intelligence on top of Azure. We will also use NodeJs and C++ beside C# code.

- Augmented Reality in Industrial Predictive Maintenance, including HoloLens (Tibor Molnar): Industry 4.0 comes with interconnected machines using IoT, cloud computing and machine learning (beside many other things). We at iQuest are working on an end to end IoT solution architecture which includes gateways for devices, IoT hubs, maintenance case predictions, real time business intelligence and augmented reality support for devices maintenance and predictive maintenance. Additionally, we are testing Augmented Reality to provide a better experience and support for field engineers doing devices maintenance work. This session will present high level an example IoT architecture, then will focus on details regarding how to implement holographic and object augmentation experiences in devices maintenance using Microsoft Hololens, Unity, Visual Studio and the PTC Vuforia platform.

Sponsor: Endava
meetup-ITCamp-Community-235877883.title: Winter ITCamp Community Event
meetup-ITCamp-Community-235877883.venue: Endava, United Business Center: Al. Vaida Voievod nr. 51, Cluj-Napoca

meetup-Java-Day-Cluj-Napoca-234290695.description:
Eoin Woods, CTO at Endava, is speaker at Software Architecture Day Iasi! 

Eoin will sustain on November 22, a full day workshop about Timeless Skills for the Modern Software Architect.

He is a widely published author in both the research and industrial communities, and is co-author of the book “Software Systems Architecture“. He involves actively as conference speaker and member of the London Software Engineering Community. His main technical interests are software architecture, distributed systems and computer security.


TOPICS:

• Using Architecture Principles to unify design thinking across different levels of abstraction;

• Different approaches to architectural description from informal sketches, to formal graphical models, and the various options between these extremes;

• The fundamentals of getting systems from development to production, which underpin approaches such as DevOps;

• Assessing software architectures using methods like ATAM, TARA and informal approaches;

• Dealing with legacy systems and supporting the teams responsible for them.


You can find more information here: www.iasi.softwarearchitectureday.com 

Software Architecture Day is an unique event, designed for technical team leads, architects, engineering directors, and project managers who influence innovation in their teams.

Richard Warburton - Independent Software Developer, Book Author si Technical Trainer, is speaker on November 18 at Java Day Cluj-Napoca. He will support a hands-on workshop about Advanced Java 8.

Topics:

·  Data Parallelism

·  Testing and Debugging Lambdas

·  Default and static methods on interfaces

·  Enhanced Design with Lambdas

·  Date & Time in Java 8

He obtained a PhD in Computer Science from The University of Warwick.

PMI Romania Chapter has the pleasure of inviting you to a new Monthly Meeting in Cluj, on November 23rd 2016, hosted by SOFTVISION.

Meeting Topic: Artificial Intelligence in Management

Agenda
18:15 – 18:45   Registration / Snacks / Networking
18:45 – 19:00   PMI Presentation – Ethics in project management – Cristina Has
19:00 – 19:10   Host company presentation: SOFTVISION – Paul Cipcigan
19:10 – 19:40   Presentation: AI in Management – Cristina Morariu

AI starts to play an increased role in our daily lives. Advances in deep neural networks design after 2010 have allowed development of deep learning based classifiers for natural language processing, concept extraction, emotion analysis, and speech/image recognition. These are now the building blocks for future applications that promise to change and normalize both human-machine and machine-machine interactions. In this talk we will discuss evolution of AI with the goal of understanding how it will impact our activities, in an IT and management perspective, in near and medium terms.

19:40 – 20:00   Break / Snacks / Networking
20:00 – 20:45   Panel Discussion
20:45 –   Networking

- Cristina Morariu, PMP – Cristina has obtained the MSc. degree in Computer Science in 2006 at Technical University of Cluj-Napoca and in 2013 obtained her PhD. degree in automatic control at Polytechnics University of Bucharest, Faculty of Automatic Control and Computer Science. She is the mother of two, passionate about Tarantino movies and Artificial Intelligence. As a day to day job, Cristina is a Project Manager at SOFTVISION.

- Cristian Baciu – over 12 years’ experience in the software industry and over 4 years in entrepreneurship and consulting. Currently Senior Engineering Manager at 3Pillar Global. Areas of expertise: project and programme management, business development and risk management.

meetup-PentaBAR-Cluj-Tech-Meetup-by-Pent.description:
Cognitive Computing

Cognitive Computing - the first remarcable steps towards artificial intelect and simulation of the human brain in a digital environment. Cognitive computing involves self-learning systems that use data mining, pattern recognition and natural language processing to mimic the way the human brain works. The goal of cognitive computing is to create automated IT systems that are capable of solving problems without requiring human assistance. Cognitive computing systems use machine learning algorithms. Such systems continually acquire knowledge from the data fed into them by mining data for information. The systems refine the way they look for patterns and as well as the way they process data so they become capable of anticipating new problems and modeling possible solutions.

meetup-Product-Camp-Bucharest-Meetup-235.description:
Hi Product Campers,

Our next meetup is about “Contractual Risks” by Lawyer Ioana Anda Bălașa

"What are the consequences of not having mentioned the unilateral termination of a service contract?

What options do you have if the client is not paying you?

What are the hidden risks to consider when the lease agreement on your office headquarters is close to expiration?

This workshop, built upon my years of experience in working with both young and experienced entrepreneurs, aims to provide insight into how even the simplest contractual clauses can hide unfortunate consequences that can lead anywhere from loss of profit to loss or reputation or even bankruptcy.

Understanding such issues can help you make an informed decision and mitigate risks or even avoid them altogether."

In the second part we have Open Space and we invite you to come up with your topic or question related to Product Development, Software Product Management, or anything related to our theme.

Agenda:

18:45 - 19:00 Welcome Product Campers

19:00 - 20:00 "Contractual Risks” by Lawyer Ioana Anda Bălașa

20:00 - 20:10 BREAK

20:10 - 21:15 Open Space

See you at Tech Hub Bucharest on Monday, 23rd January 2017!

Salut!

Pentru urmatorul meetup, va propunem o sesiune cu accent pe comunicare. Alexandru Moldovan e un specialist in educatie experientiala si un trainer cu o experinta foarte vasta in cadrul mai multor organizatii si companii. A fost presedinte al organizatiei Cercetasii Romaniei, precum si director de HR in cadrul unei companii multinationale. El vine acum la Tabara pentru a ne oferi un context de invatare valoros pentru noi. Mai multe detalii despre Alexandru Moldovan pe profilul lui de LinkedIn si pe Twitter

Mai jos sunt detaliile evenimentului:

What does this button do?

Alexandru Moldovan

Sunt situații în care parcă nu contează cât de răbdători suntem în general sau cât de ”evoluați” emoțional am devenit: sunt oameni care ne apasă acele ”butoane”!

Iar unii dintre ei, uneori cei mai apropiați nouă, parcă sunt experți în asta. Reușesc cu o singură remarcă sau o privire bine țintită să ne transforme din persoane sensibile și raționale în adevărați maniaci sau cel puțin să ne ”vibreze” o venă la tâmplă.

Deși identificarea sursei acestor butoane e la fel de relevantă, în acest workshop ne vom concentra pe conștientizarea reacției noastre și posibile alternative de răspuns. Vom folosi câteva concepte din ”comunicarea non-violentă” a lui Marshall Rosenberg, cu două aplicații practice la situații reale din viața noastră personală sau profesională.

Va asteptam!

meetup-Tabara-de-Testare-Timisoara-mktmf.description:
Salutare, 

Iata ce ne-au pregatit gazdele noastre de la Softvision:

In prima parte o sa vedem un demo despre "Security testing using Fiddler and other security issues" 

1.Security Testing using Fiddler and other security issues
1.1 What is Fiddler, brief introduction
1.2 Useful features of Fiddler for security testing : Filter, Breakpoints, Reissue Request, Compose, Auto Respond
1.3 Real life examples of security risks exposed by using Fiddler :
Reissue request causing issues with double entries.
How Breakpoint expose server issues.
Auto respond to verify you app in case of bad responses.
1.4 Fiddler, Other features like performance measurement
1.5 Basic SQL injection.
1.6 Basic XSS injection.
1.7 Other approaches for a solid and secure app

Apoi, trei tracku-ri in paralel, astfel incat puteti alege ce va intereseaza mai mult.

Open Corners: 2.First Steps of big date testing
2.1 Characteristics of Big Data
2.2 Testing Methods
2.3 Tools
3.Juggling automation and manual testing in everyday life
3.1. Employee, Employer & Client Expectations
3.2. Our Constraints
3.3. Great Decisions
4.Managing Outsourced QA Teams
4.1 Listen, Ask, Propose and React - Earning customer's trust
4.2 Consultancy mindset - a different QA attribute
4.3 Mission impossible or how we are delivering the edge cases

Fiind editie aniversara, mai avem si alte surprize :)

Va asteptam cu drag!

===========================================

Mai jos e lista cu propunerile pe urmatorul an:

- Training SQL - Nivel Mediu (recapitulare nivel Basic, la inceput)

- Time and Risk Management

- Comunicare - colegi, dev/tester

* Biblioteca cu informatii utile:

- certificari, carti, linkuri (recomandare: http://testhuddle.com/)

meetup-Tech-Makers-Designers-235324506.description:
Dragi Techies, 

În calitate de membri ai comunității Tech Academy, vă invităm să participați gratuit la Transylvania MegaHack, eveniment cu care debutează festivalul tehnologic Cluj TechFest vineri, pe 11 noiembrie. 

MegaHack din cadrul TechFest este un eveniment dedicat programatorilor și echipelor de programatori care vor răspunde unor provocări lansate de diverse companii, provocări reale cu care acestea se confruntă și pentru care caută cele mai bune soluții. 

Alege-ți provocarea, înscrie-ți echipa și puteți câștiga unul dintre premiile care au o valoare totală de 10,000 EUR. Pentru că faci parte din comunitatea TechAcademy beneficiezi de înscriere gratuită. 

Folosește codul TECHACADEMYFRIENDS și înscrie-te acum: http://techfest.ro/register-for-access/ 

CDS, Onyx Beacon, Braintronix, Security4Things și Vector Watch au pregătit provocări pentru tine. Detalii despre ele, formularul de înregistrare dar și despre restul challenge-urilor găsești pe pagina Transylvania MegaHack.

_____________________________________________________________________


AGENDA: 

Ziua 1, vineri, 11 noiembrie

16:00 - 17:00 - Înregistrarea participanților

17:00 - 18:00 - Indroducere / Cuvânt înainte al d-lui primar Emil Boc / Prezentarea partenerilor

18:00 - 18:20- Programul evenimentului / Briefing-ul challenge-urilor / Formarea echipelor

18:20-18:30 / Pregătiți să începem? “Engage!”

18:30 - 20:00 - Hacking

20:00 - 21:00 - Pauză de pizza (din partea casei)

No sleep required. Sleep is overrated anyway.

Ziua 2, sâmbătă, 12 noiembrie

09:00 - 10:00 - Cafea și snaks-uri (din partea casei)

10:00 - 18:00 - Mai mult hacking

Echipele pot lua pauză de masă oricând doresc (masa de prânz nu este inclusă dar vă oferim vouchere de reduceri la Food Court)

18:00 - 19:00 - Pauză de pizza (din partea casei)

Sleep is for the weak and weaklings don’t make it through the Long Winter!

Ziua 3, duminică, 13 noiembrie

09:00 - 10:00 - Cafea și snaks-uri (din partea casei)

10:00 - 14:00 - Și mai mult hacking

Echipele pot lua pauză de masă oricând doresc (masa de prânz nu este inclusă dar vă oferim vouchere de reduceri la Food Court) 15:00 - 17:15 - Pauză

17:15 - 19:00 - Sesiune de pitching

19:00 - 19:30 - Festivitatea de premiere

_____________________________________________________________________

Înscrie-te GRATUIT acum: http://techfest.ro/register-for-access/

Competițiile de tip hackathon presupun încercarea lucrurilor noi, experimentare și testarea de noi soluții.
Te așteptăm!
meetup-Tech-Makers-Designers-235324506.title: Transylvania MegaHack @ClujTechFest
meetup-Tech-Makers-Designers-235324506.venue: Iulius Mall - Spațiul expozițional nivel -1: Str. Al. V. Voevod nr. 53-55, Cluj-Napoca

meetup-The-Bucharest-Agile-Software-Meet.description:
Welcome to our newest Meetup within Agile Works community! 

Scrum&Wine is a wine tasting & networking event dedicated for the Scrum Masters, Agile Coaches, Technical Leads and Developers out there. 


We gather to have a relaxing time, where we mix business and pleasure, to share experiences and stories, all of this accompanied by a glass of wine. 

Topics proposed for discussion are leadership, mentoring, , coaching, agile stories, feedback and people growth. 

First edition will take place on the 16th November (Wednesday), starting with 19:00. The location is Marvin Winebar, see map here: https://goo.gl/maps/9mg3ZGeMCvJ2 . 

The maximum number of participants is 20 participants due to selected venue. Each participant will be responsible for paying for their own beverage. 

IMPORTANT: as soon as you know you can no longer attend the meeting please change your RSVP to NO immediately. Consider this gesture a sign of respect towards other members of this group who might want to attend in your place.

Make sure you install Vivino - https://www.vivino.com/app/
meetup-The-Bucharest-Agile-Software-Meet.organizer: The Bucharest Agile Software Meetup Group
meetup-The-Bucharest-Agile-Software-Meet.title: Scrum & Wine
meetup-The-Bucharest-Agile-Software-Meet.venue: Marvin Wineshop: Strada Sfântul Elefterie 8, Bucharest

meetup-The-Bucharest-Agile-Software-Meet.description:
What

The code and beer idea is simple enough: we gather in the evening after work, in a pub, have a beer and write some code. It is a social coding event where you can share ideas with other developers. You can come and leave whenever you want.

Why would you come and join us

Meet other programmers
Work on your own project
Help others with their projects
Find someone who might help you with a specific topic
Pair with someone and learn new things
Just hang around and talk to people

How

Bring your laptop and some code that you'll be working on. If you don't have code then think about what you would like to practice during the evening.

There is no predefined agenda. We just meet and work on whatever we feel like.

Important

Please specify what you would like to do during the evening by answering the question "What would you like to practice?" when registering.

Also, as soon as you know you can no longer attend the meeting please change your RSVP to NO immediately. Consider this gesture a sign of respect towards other members of this group who might want to attend in your place.

The number of attendees is limited because of the difficulties of finding a big pub and making reservations for a big group.
meetup-The-Bucharest-Agile-Software-Meet.organizer: The Bucharest Agile Software Meetup Group
meetup-The-Bucharest-Agile-Software-Meet.title: Code and beer

meetup-The-Bucharest-Agile-Software-Meet.description:
This time, we are going to use Test Driven Development to write a program to show that the 13th day of the month falls more often on a Friday than any other day of the week.


---------------

A Coding Dojo is a team practice format that accelerates knowledge transfer and sharing skills between team members. With an experienced facilitator, it is also a way of learning by applying various techniques.

Objectives

The following skills are typical candidates for improvement during a dojo:

• Refactoring
• Simple design
• Clean code
• Improving pair programming technique
• How to safely modify code you don't understand (usually legacy code)
• Learning a new programming language
• Unit testing
• Test driven development

In addition, coding dojo can be used by a team as a collective and structured way of solving difficult or risky problems related to production, like fixing a bug or redesigning parts of the application.

How it works?

The basic format of a coding dojo:

• All developers and the facilitator gather in a room.
• The facilitator introduces the purpose and the format of the coding dojo.
• One laptop with a functional development environment is connected to a projector.
• Two developers pair program on the laptop. The others are in the room, watching the code changes.
• Every 7 minutes, one developer leaves the laptop and the next one from the room takes his place.
• After a specified period of time (usually around two hours), the dojo ends with a retrospective.

meetup-The-Bucharest-Agile-Software-Meet.description:
Hi,

I invite you all to Agile Talks #18 event.  Last edition you requested more technical topics. Therefore, this month we have invited two software engineers to share with us their experience. 

The first speaker is Alin Pandichi which you all know as facilitator and organizer of the Coding Dojo meetup and the Global Day of Coderetreat event. He will show us the simplest and most effective way of understanding Test Driven Development(TDD) through a live coding session. More details about his talk here.

Second speaker is Bianca Leuca, Software Engineer at MozaicLabs and active member of our community. With her talk, Agile Retrospectives, she is sharing with us the practices behind efficient retrospectives.

Agenda:

18:45 - 19:00 Arriving, socializing
19:00 - 19:10 Introduction  
19:10 - 19:40 Agile Retrospectives
19:40 - 20:10 Intro to TDD - Live coding session 
20:10 - 20:20 Break
20:20 - 21:10 Open Space - ask the speakers for more details or propose interesting topics
21:10 - 21:20 Retrospective & Closing

See you on 9th November!

meetup-The-Bucharest-Agile-Software-Meet.description:
Hi,

I invite you all to celebrate with us the start of the winter holidays.

This edition we have one talk and two speakers.

Automated Pipelines with Jenkins, Ansible and Docker in the Cloud. A Case Study 


Alexandru Pătrănescu, Architect and Dragoș Șuțu, Developer at PayU Group Technology Center will present how you can use Ansible, Jenkins, Docker and Docker Swarm to provision a complex system for Continuous Integration in the Cloud.

Alex will talk about the journey they've taken from having a wild local development environment to a standard solution, then a cloud-ready CI environment.

Dragoș will show the magic in a Hands-on Demo.

Agenda:


18:45 - 19:00 Arriving, socializing
19:00 - 19:10 Introduction
19:10 - 20:10 Automated Pipelines with Jenkins, Ansible and Docker in the Cloud. A Case Study
20:10 - 20:20 Break
20:20 - 21:10 Open Space - ask the speakers for more details or propose interesting topics
21:10 - 21:20 Retrospective & Closing

See you on December 7th!

Check out the community <a>vimeo</a> channel for talks we had in previous events. Enjoy!

meetup-The-Cluj-Napoca-Agile-Software-Me.description:
Let's get together to write good code and discuss interesting topics in IT.

Bring your laptop and your code or think about something that you would like to practice or discuss. There is NO pre-established agenda. It is up to you to come forth with ideas and make these meetings worth-while for you and the rest of the group.


Code & Beer is meant for people that want to learn and teach others.


We aim to create a "human knowledge-base" that will help each participant improve him/herself. It's important to actively contribute to these meetings with topics that you find interesting or puzzling. These could include: a technical problem that you encountered while working on your projects, an interesting article that you've read, a new technology/framework/language, TDD, coding best practices and patterns etc.

Be prepared to do some pair-programming. Don't be afraid to share your code and your opinions. It's the best way to learn and improve yourself.

The format:

(The schedule is not strict, what follows are just some guidelines to provide our meetings with some structure. You may arrive and leave at any time.)

The meetings last about 2 hours, starting from 7 p.m. Between 7.15 - 7.30 we have a very short introduction about the purpose of the meeting, the participants and what they want to practice. After that, we pair up and start coding and discussing.

If you decide to attend, please RSVP. This will help us determine the number of spots to reserve. When you know you cannot attend the meeting any more please change your RSVP to NO as soon as possible.
meetup-The-Cluj-Napoca-Agile-Software-Me.organizer: The Cluj Napoca Agile Software Meetup Group

meetup-The-Cluj-Napoca-Agile-Software-Me.venue: Zorki Photo Cafe: Str. Ion Rațiu nr.10, Cluj-Napoca

meetup-The-Human-Side-Group-Iasi-2354273.description:
Entrepreneurship has become a hot topic nowadays and everyone seems to want a piece of it. Programs that sustain and accelerate startups, angel investors, crowdfunding websites and millions of articles and gurus that want to teach you how to grow your business stand witness to this madness.

It's obvious that startups play a very important role in the world's economy. Even though many of them fail within their first year, the ones that survive create opportunities for innovation, economical and social welfare and provide educational environments that nurture future companies who will shape and revolutionize industries.

There is no surprise that our country falls behind other european countries, but I've always asked myself how is Iasi treating its entrepreneurs ? How many do we have here ? What are the biggest problems they are facing ?And the most important question, who can I ask for guidance if I want to start a business?

Let's talk about the problems that we can solve, so we can create a more friendly environment for startups.

If you have someone in mind who started a business and you want to be present, just let me know and I'll do my best to get him or her.
meetup-The-Human-Side-Group-Iasi-2354273.title: Entrepreneurship in Iasi
meetup-The-Human-Side-Group-Iasi-2354273.venue: Optymyze: Palas 7E, UBC 3, etaj 5, Iasi, Iasi

meetup-The-Iasi-Agile-Software-Meetup-Gr.description:
Are you disappointed or frustrated by the results of your Agile approach?


Have you put in place the roles, artifacts, practices and rituals and you did not realised the promised benefits? If so, you're not alone.


This is a classic problem, due to textbook Agile implementations that are rigid, mechanical, and driven by so-called "best practices" 

Join us to discuss about what it means to be agile. We will examine the most often overlooked, subjective, personal, and intangible pieces that are often missing from effective agile implementations.


Speaker: Ionut Grecu
meetup-The-Iasi-Agile-Software-Meetup-Gr.organizer: The Iasi Agile Software Meetup Group
meetup-The-Iasi-Agile-Software-Meetup-Gr.title: From Dogma to Light: Embracing The Agile Mindset
meetup-The-Iasi-Agile-Software-Meetup-Gr.venue: InSync Go: Sfantul Lazar, numarul 4, bl. Penes Curcanul, Iasi

meetup-The-Startup-Lab-235643470.description:
Hello everybody!

Let's get together for a hands-on Design Sprint Session. The topic will be the design of an addictive game for kids to learn visual programming.

Design Thinking as a problem-solving method has been prevalent in product design for several decades and has more recently been adapted for business and education. And like any process that has enjoyed that kind of longevity, it must periodically adapt to changes in environment and landscape


In  preparation for the meetup please watch "Stanford Design Thinking Virtual Crash Course"  and check out MIT Scratch  

Detauls of the program will follow shortly.

meetup-The-Startup-Lab-235643470.venue: Petru Maior University - Room L31: Nicolae Iorga 1, Targu Mures, Targu-Mures

meetup-TiMoDev-235710973.description:
Timisoara Mobile Development Group and the local Google Developer Group are jointly inviting city's tech passionates to an event that will close the year in force!

We will focus on Firebase, the 15 tools kit supporting serverless architecture and significantly faster mobile (both iOS & Android) and web development.

We'll get the community together for a less practiced event format: participants will experience a guided, hands-on coding experience crafted by Googlers for developers. Some communities run it with a talk. A speaker introducing Firebase tools (TBC) will followed with a 45-60 minutes codelab session, so make sure you'll bring your laptops!

Participants will receive swag offered by Google Firebase and will enter a (CEE regional) contest for winning a free ticket to Google I/O 2017! 

We are charging a small participation fee you may pay from your card or PayPal acount via Meetup.com in order to organize for catering.

If you will not be in Timisoara for that day, check on this map, maybe you can attend another Firebase event.

Looking forward to share the Christmas tech magic with you!

Radu Ticiu & Silviu Vert
meetup-TiMoDev-235710973.title: TiMo & GDG Christmas Firebase Codelab
meetup-TiMoDev-235710973.venue: Timișoara Startup Hub: 10th, C. Brediceanu St., E Building, Timisoara, Timisoara

meetup-Transylvania-Java-User-Group-2354.description:
Meeting #58 - Java 8 Lambda Puzzlers

Abstract:

After working with lambdas in Java 8 for a couple of years, we have found some interesting edge cases and features of lambdas. 

What are some of the consequences of Type Inference?How to work with checked Exceptions and lambdas?What is the difference between capturing and non-capturing lambdas, and how doe this impact performance and serialization?What are some of the gotchas of sharing lambdas across a distributed system?

About the speaker:

Peter Lawrey has a popular blog “Vanilla Java” which gets 120K page views per months, is 3rd on StackOverflow.com for [Java] and 2nd for [concurrency], and is lead developer of the OpenHFT project which includes support for off heap memory, thread pinning and low latency persistence and IPC (as low as 100 nano-seconds)

He  likes to inspire developers to improve the craftsmanship of their solutions, engineer their systems for simplicity and performance, and enjoy their work more by being creative and innovative. 


Agenda

18:30 - 19:00 reception

19:00 ~ 20:00 presentation

20:00 - 20:30 Q&A followed by networking

Event sponsored by Accesa & Today Software Magazine
meetup-Transylvania-Java-User-Group-2354.title: meeting #58 with  Peter Lawrey  on "java 8 lambda puzzlers"
meetup-Transylvania-Java-User-Group-2354.venue: hotel Opera Plaza - sala Cristal: Strada General Traian Moșoiu, Cluj-Napoca

meetup-angularjs-cluj-234890739.description:
In this Meetup we are going to have a look at what Xamarin Forms has to offer to build cross platform mobile applications.

In the first part we will start with an intro about Xamarin, what are its benefits and drawbacks and in the second part we will do a demo where we will deploy and debug an application written in C# on iOS and Android.

Difficulty: Beginner

Duration: About 1h 30m
meetup-angularjs-cluj-234890739.title: Getting Started with Developing Cross-Platform Apps with Xamarin Forms

meetup-angularjs-cluj-235435286.description:
At this meetup we will focus on building an API in Golang with RethinkDb.

We will walk though the basic syntax of any Golang application, then move to more practical subjects like:

- Web frameworks

- Working with a database

- Organising your code

- Building an API

- IDEs

The meetup will have an open format so that everyone can contribute, but it will focus on a code already written in Golang.

Difficulty: Beginner

Duration: around 1 hour
meetup-angularjs-cluj-235435286.title: Building an API with Golang and Rethinkdb

meetup-eat-pray-tech-235414307.description:
Suntem înconjurați de tehnologie, ne hrănim cu ea și, în consecință, ne influențează modul în care gândim și trăim. 


La eat/pray/tech dorim să ne întâlnim și să ne împingem gândurile dincolo de limitările acesteia. Vrem să căutăm răspunsuri acolo unde 1+1 nu dă întotdeauna 2.

Ne frământăm cu întrebările importante și dificile ale vieții, îndreptându-ne ochii, inima și mintea spre Dumnezeu.

Nu în ultimul rând, ne întâlnim ca să ne cunoaștem mai bine, să luăm micul dejun împreună și, bineînțeles, și prima doză de cafeină a zilei.



Unde?

HUGO Restaurants, cladirea The Office, Bulevardul 21 Decembrie 1989 nr. 77.


Cost

Taxa este de 20 RON și se va achita la locație, numerar. Aceasta reprezintă contravaloarea unui bogat mic dejun, cu suc și cafea.

Social Media

O să comunicăm pe Facebook, Twitter si Instagram folosind #EatPrayTech.
meetup-eat-pray-tech-235414307.title: eat/pray/tech #6

meetup-the-javascript-timisoara-group-23.description:
Welcome to the third JavaScript workshop, organized by tim.js.

This workshop focuses on various ways to organize your code, each with it's own pros & cons. We will cover fundamental ES5 concepts, while also touching some new features added since ES6.

CONTENT

- Spaghetti Code
- Object Literals
- Module Pattern
- Revealing Module Pattern
- Module systems & loaders
- ES6 Modules
